intro: Malesherbia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
